entries.meaning: (law) The lawful claim and recovery, by a person, of goods wrongly taken from him
examples: The ordinance affirmed the common-law right of masters to recapture fugitives on their own, without coming before a magistrate. By contrast, Article IV omitted mention of self-help recaption or reclamation.

verbs.description: recaption (third-person singular simple present recaptions, present participle recaptioning, simple past and past participle recaptioned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To assign a new caption to.
examples: The newspaper was forced to recaption the photograph to avoid a libel suit.
